Sample.Title: brain1_cx

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: barcoding of progenitor cells was achieved via in utero microinjection
Channel.Growth-Protocol: mice were kept in standard housing conditions
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Brains were dissected and single cell dissociations prepared using the Papain dissociation system with manual trituration. Purified single cell suspensions were processed according to the manufacturer's instructions. Chromium: Brains were dissected and single cell dissociations prepared using the Papain dissociation system with manual trituration. Purified single cell suspensions were processed according to the manufacturer's instructions. Visium: Brains were fresh frozen, 10 µm cryosections mounted and fixed on a Visium glass slide +/- immunostaining and libraries prepared according to the manufacturer's instructions. Amplicon: full length cDNA obtained during Chromium or Visium library preparation. 10X Genomics Chromium Single Cell 3' v2 and v3; 10X Visium Spatial Gene Expression; Nested PCR

Sample.Data-Processing: Chromium: Sequencing reads were processed with Cell Ranger v2.2.0 (Chromium v2) or Cell Ranger v3.0.1 (Chromium v3); Visium: Sequencing reads were processed with Space Ranger 1.0.0 Genome_build: mm10 with additional sequence representing the H2B-EGFP-N transgene Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Chromium: filtered gene count matrix; Visium: filtered gene count matrix, aligned images, spot coordinates

Series.Title: Cell types and clonal relations in the mouse brain revealed by single-cell and spatial transcriptomics
Series.Summary: We report TREX for simultaneous lineage tracking and expression profiling of dissociated cells from the juvenile mouse brain using single cell transcriptomics. We also developed Space-TREX enabling tracking and transcriptome profiling in intact tissue sections via Spatial Transcriptomics.
Series.Overall-Design: Lentiviral delivery of a transcribed barcode into neuroepithelial progenitor cells using in utero microinjection into the mouse forebrain at embryonic day 9.5 followed by RNA-seq analysis of barcoded cells at postnatal day 11-14.
Series.Type: Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing
